content: stitches into the back loops only of round 42…take note of the unworked front loops beneath the slip stitches… you will work the next round round 43 beneath those front loops…this creates an extra thick round that helps to define the neck and supports the head a little here s a two tone version you ll see the two loops on top formed by the slip stitches and then the unworked front loop beneath them you re working into the stitches beneath that unworked front loop round 43 single_crochet into each of the first 6sts work 2sc into each of the next 4sts single_crochet into each of the remaining 6sts the increases should be in the 4sts at the very front of the head feel free to adjust their placement by a st or two if you need to 20sts round 44 single_crochet into each of the first 5sts work 2sc into each of the next 10sts single_crochet into each of the remaining 5sts again the increases should span the front of the head evenly feel free to adjust their placement by a st or two if you need to 30sts round 45 single_crochet in each of the first 4sts work 2sc into the next st *single_crochet in each of the next 4sts work 2sc into the next st repeat from * around 36sts round 46 single_crochet in each of the first 5sts work 2sc into the next st *single_crochet in each of the next 5sts work 2sc into the next st repeat from * around 42sts round 47 single_crochet in each of the first 6sts work 2sc into the next st *single_crochet in each of the next 6sts work 2sc into the next st repeat from * around 48sts round 48 51 single_crochet in each st around 48sts round 52 pause to place markers for ears start by identifying two stitches at the front of the head then count 12sts to the left and place a marker then place a marker 12sts to the right you should have 24sts between the two markers single_crochet in each st until you reach the first marker work a 4dc bobble see special stitches in the marked st remove marker single_crochet in each of the next 24sts until you reach the next marker work a 4dc bobble in the marked st remove marker single_crochet in each of the remaining sts around 48sts including 2 bobble sts now mark two stitches 7-8 stitches apart for the safety eyes between rounds 51 & 52 rnds 53 60 single_crochet in each st around 48sts place safety eyes on marked round with 5-6 stitches showing between them tip if your doll is for a child under the age of 3 do not use safety eyes safety eyes are not suitable for children under 3 consider embroidering the eyes instead or simply crochet 2 black circles of 6sc and sew them on you can place markers in the stitches indicated if you want to do these after completing
